content.description: A student claims that the <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> chromosome contains the sex-determining region gene, known as the <math alttext="S R Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><mi>S</mi><mi>R</mi><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> gene, which causes male fetuses to develop testes.
content.question: Which of the following provides correct information about cell signaling that supports the claim?

choices.label: The <math alttext="S R Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><mi>S</mi><mi>R</mi><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> gene produces a protein that binds to specific regions of <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in certain tissues, which affects the development of these tissues.

The <math alttext="S R Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><mi>S</mi><mi>R</mi><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> gene produces a protein that deletes portions of the <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> chromosome in males so that male characteristics can develop.

The <math alttext="S R Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><mi>S</mi><mi>R</mi><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> gene produces an <math alttext="R N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>RNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> segment that is exported from specific cells and targets the developing gonads.

The <math alttext="S R Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><mi>S</mi><mi>R</mi><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> gene is found only in tissues of the developing gonads.

content.answer: The <math alttext="S R Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><mi>S</mi><mi>R</mi><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> gene produces a protein that binds to specific regions of <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in certain tissues, which affects the development of these tissues.

skill.text: 6.C: Provide reasoning to justify a claim by connecting evidence to biological theories.
